wiki.content:
"Shame for You" is a song written by Lily Allen and Blair MacKichan, produced by MacKichan for Allen's debut album Alright, Still. It was released as a double A-sided single, with "Alfie", in the UK on March 5, 2007, as a CD single, 7" vinyl and digital download. The vocal melody is loosely based on a horn line of a Jackie Mittoo song titled "Loving You" off the album "Evening Time". There was no video filmed for the song.
 
 "Shame For You", along with "Alfie", charted at #15 in the UK.

wiki.summary: "Shame for You" is a song written by Lily Allen and Blair MacKichan, produced by MacKichan for Allen's debut album Alright, Still. It was released as a double A-sided single, with "Alfie", in the UK on March 5, 2007, as a CD single, 7" vinyl and digital download. The vocal melody is loosely based on a horn line of a Jackie Mittoo song titled "Loving You" off the album "Evening Time". There was no video filmed for the song.  "Shame For You", along with "Alfie", charted at #15 in the UK.
